column5: Hey everyone  I really like the pricepoint on the St.Croix mojo bass rods... I can pick up a skeet reese/Curado E5 combo for $250 plus tax. but I dont know about the Skeet rods... read some bad reviews on the BPS web site  mojo bass and the skeet rods are with in $10 of each other... so its kind of a toss up  Any body using these rods ? used both ? any comparisons ?  Thanks !
I have 5 Mojo's and love them. Never used the Skeet's but very happy with the Mojo's.
From what I've heard you can't go wrong with the Mojo Bass.  All around good rods at a very reasonable price.
mojo...w&m is not known for quality, especially in my experience...and st. croix is a better rod IMO and has better warranty
MOJO.  Tough to beat at that price.
I picked up a mojo last week, for the price a very decent stick...
Bought my first mojo this summer and was very impressed. Picked up a 6'8" spinning. Will look at their heavy action next season as my 7' pitching rod needs upgrading
i used the mojo rods all of last year before switching to a new sponsor rod company. the mojo's are excellant rods, i had 4 or 5 of them, and still have one that i use from time to time.

Was looking at the mojo's yesterday at BPS. Gotta see how much Lebaron sells them for but its a decent rod. Any of you have an extra one to sell in the Toronto Area? MH F to XF 6'10 or longer one piece?
Unfortunately, Le Baron doesn't carry St. Croix.
The Skeet Reese rods are good rods aswell but they also offer a Lifetime Warranty rather than the 5yr that the Mojo series has.  I would buy the Skeet Reese rods rather than the mojo's.
